result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on December 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:11 PM Defendant Leequane Anthony Mcgowan not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. This the thrid attempt to have defendant to appear.Court indicated that prison refused to leave cell and participate. matter to be set one more time for initial via zoom. 2:15 PM
Initial appearance on October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Initial appearance on September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ENTERED IN ERROR.

9:38 AM Defendant Leequane Anthony Mcgowan not in court.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Court states the prison indicated defendant was refusing to leave cell and participate, matter to be reset for Initial Appearance, 9:42 A.M.
Initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:39 PM Defendant Leequane Anthony Mcgowan not in court.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. The staff from CCI indicated by video Zoom that defendant did not want to participate in the court hearing, refused to come out of his cell, matter to be reset for an Initial Appearance, Public Defender's Office to be notified.
